critique: The document is an executive order regarding the International Exhibition of Arts, Manufactures, and Products of the Soil and Mine in Philadelphia in 1876. The order aims to showcase the functions and resources of the US government. The tone is formal and administrative. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are likely joy (celebrating the anniversary of independence), and perhaps a sense of surprise and awe at the demonstration of the government's capabilities. There's also an element of pride and confidence the President wants to convey. There is little to suggest sadness, fear, or disgust.
